items.content: Navigation History: Let's Grow! Home > Grow More! > The Media File

The Media File is a collection of media related assignments you do. Think of assignments related to news, books, tv and the internet.

During school year 2016-2017, the Media File includes doing three book-related Assignments and three Book Analyses (so, one Assignment and one Book Analysis per book). It's a portfolio that showcases which books you've read and your understanding of said books. We have made some changes after the first deadline (e.g. no video diary anymore). That's why it's important to read this page thoroughly.

Handing in: You hand in the Media File as a word file in 'Magister opdrachten'. Some media file assignments require you to post something online. This can be a private video on YouTube / Vimeo / Onedrive / GoogleDrive, a blog on Blogger or actually sending an e-mail to an author. This means you will have to post separate assignments elsewhere as well.

New The Video Diary part of the Media File is no longer part of the Media File this year. Instead, you'll write a Book Analysis which includes: a brief summary about your book, the answers to three thought and analysis provoking questions (that you choose).

Grades: For each Media File you will receive separate grades for the Assignment and for the Book Analysis. The average grade of these two will be the grade for your Media File and it will count 2x,

The image below should make things clear.

Glossary:

  • diary = dagboek
  • assignment = opdracht
  • collection = verzameling
  • showcases = laten zien
  • understanding = begrip
  • said = eerder genoemde
  • hand in = inleveren
  • in addition = bovendien, daarnaast
  • require = vereisen
  • actually = eigenlijk, echt
  • separate = losse
  • elsewhere = andere plekken
  • meaning = wat betekent
  • grade = cijfer
  • weight = gewicht
  • brief = korte
  • average = gemiddeld

When do these periods end?

  1. Friday 2 December
  2. Friday 10 March
  3. Friday 19 May

Types of Media and Assignments

You choose from one of the four assignments below every time you read a book:

  1. Write Fan Fiction about your book on https://www.fanfiction.net/ (create an account or use facebook to log in)
  2. Write a review on https://www.blogger.com (log in with google account)
  3. Vlog a review on Youtube / Vimeo / Google Drive or OneDrive.
  4. Write an e-mail to the author ((B)CC teacher in E-mail)
  5. Create a trailer about the book (post it on https://www.youtube.com/ (private is optional) / upload it to OneDrive (office 365) and insert the link in your hand-in file.)
  • You will also always include a Book Analysis in which you answer three questions of choice and provide a summary. (This replaces the Video Diary we had in period 1)

Extensive / elaborate instructions on these assignments can be found in the other lessons within this course.

Glossary:

  • at least = ten minste
  • session = sessie
  • extensive / elaborate = uitgebreide
  • lesson = les
  • course = lessenserie
  • in addition = daarbij,

Goals

So, now that you have read a book, we are extremely curious if you can make any sense of it. By writing a brief summary and answering 3 questions of your choice, we hope to find that out.

Goals:

  • becoming more proficient in/better at analysing literary works
  • being able to link what you've read to other contexts/ the world

Assignment Book Analysis

This compulsory written Book Analysis replaces the Video Diary

Assignment years 1 and 2 H/A:

  • Write a brief summary (one paragraph, max 100-150 words) by answering the following questions:
    • who (characters)
    • when (time)
    • where (place)
    • what (happenings and themes)
    • why (motives)
  • Choose 3 questions from the list below
  • Mention them in your word file
  • Write three short paragraphs (max. 100-150 words each) in which you answer the questions
  • Check if you have met all the requirements (see Requirements Book Analysis below)

Assignment years 3, 4 and 5 H/A:

  • Write a brief summary (one paragraph, max 200 words) by answering the following questions:
    • who (characters)
    • when (time)
    • where (place)
    • what (happenings and themes)
    • why (motives)
  • Choose 3 questions from the list below
  • Mention them in your word file
  • Write three insightful paragraphs (max. 200 words each) in which you answer the questions.
  • Your answers should reflect your understanding of the book and how it relates to different dimensions. E.g. history, present day, your or someone else's life
  • Check if you have met all the requirements (see Requirements Book Analysis below)

Requirements and Questions Book Analysis

This compulsory written Book Analysis replaces the Video Diary

Requirements years 1 and 2 H/A:

  • Your summary has no more than 150 words
  • Your summary answers all the who/when/where/what/why questions
  • Three questions were chosen and answered
  • Your answers are at the appropriate level/show a proper analysis (see the rubric below when you are unsure if your answers are at the right level/contain sufficient depth)
  • Your answers to each question are no langer than 150 words
  • Your summary, questions and answers were saved in a Media File word document which has been handed in in Magister Opdrachten
  • Your language use is at the appropriate level

The Questions years 1 and 2 H/A:

  • Are the characters or their circumstances familiar to you ?
  • Are the actions consistent with their characters?
  • Do you find their actions troubling?
  • How would you act in a similar situation?
  • Do you think the theme of the book will appeal to both young and adult?
  • If it's written recently, do you think people will still be reading it in ten years, fifty years, hundred years?
  • If it's written sometime ago, is it a book that could be written now? Why, or why not ?
  • Does it say anything about people's values at the time? Have they changed?

Glossary:

  • compulsory = verplicht
  • brief = korte
  • reflect = weerspiegelen
  • circumstances = omstandigheden
  • similar = vergelijkbare
  • sometime = enige tijd
  • values = waarden

Requirements years 3, 4 and 5 H/A:

  • Your summary has no more than 200 words
  • Your summary answers all the who/when/where/what/why questions
  • Three questions were chosen and answered
  • Your answers are at the appropriate level/show a proper analysis (see the rubric below when you are unsure if your answers are at the right level/contain sufficient depth)
  • Your answers to each question are no langer than 200 words
  • Your summary, questions and answers were saved in a Media File word document which has been handed in in Magister Opdrachten
  • Your language use is at the appropriate level

The Questions years 3, 4 and 5 H/A:

  • Describe to what extent you can relate to the main character.
  • What would you have done / said the same or differently?
  • Imagine that at this point you could talk to the main character of the book. You can give them advice, compliment them or scold them for doing stupid things. What things would you say? Support your ideas.
  • Describe how the main character has changed / grown / developed throughout the story. Think for example about what lessons they have learnt, what / how experiences in the story have changed their personality, etc.
  • Describe which lessons the main character has learnt throughout the story.
  • Describe which experiences/happenings/events have changed (one of) the main character(s) of the book.
  • If the story you've read did not take place in our time, imagine how it would be for the main character(s) to live in our time. Describe what life he / she / they would lead and what choices would be different for him / her / them.
  • What is the most important 'problem' in this story and how is it solved (if it is solved)?
  • Choose one of the following political figures and explain how they would've dealt with the situations the main character(s) faced. Angela Merkel (Germany), Barack Obama (USA), Hilary Clinton (USA), Theresa May (GB), Winston Churchill (GB), Donald Trump (USA), Vladimir Putin (Russia), Justin Trudeau (Canada).

Glossary:

  • compulsory = verplicht
  • brief = korte
  • reflect = weerspiegelen

Course HomeEdit Lesson

heading.content: Book Review on Blogger.com - individual assignment

items.content:
How to write a review on Blogger

What is Blogger?

Blogger is a free weblogging service offered by Google, part of their suite of services that include Gmail, Youtube, Google Drive and, indeed Blogger (at blogger.com). It allows you to write publicly accessible blogs on the internet.

Here are the step-by-step instructions (follow them carefully):

  • Make sure you have a Google account
  • Make sure you start on time. Check out the deadline date and put it one week earlier, so that you still have time to get ill or have technical problems without being too late.
  • Choose a book of the right level. You can choose it from the "Book Suggestions" chapter on the previous page on this site.
  • Write a review blog, meeting the following requirements:
    • You provide an appropriate opening
    • You use at least two convincing reasons to support your opinion
    • Your review is well-structured
    • You use proper and preferably varying adjectives and adverbs
    • Your language fits the level of your grade
    • Do not simply write an extract, although teasers are allowed
    • Make sure it's at least 250 words in length
    • Make sure it's your own writing, don't plagiarise!
    • It doesn't need to be positive, it may also be a negative review ;-)
    • Note your blog's URL. It should be something like http://name-of-your-blog.blogger,com
  • Download the "Hand in Media File and Feedback.docx" document from the "Hand in Media File" chapter on the previous page
  • Cut and paste all the right texts in the right spaces in that document. For the blogger assignment, this is the URL of your blog and the full text of your blog
  • Save the file with the file name "class - surname - first name.docx" (for example "3Ab - Janssen - Jan.docx"
  • Make sure you save it as a Microsoft Word document. No other file formats (Google Docs, Pages, PDF) are accepted. Everybody at the GSG has free access to Microsoft Office 365. You can install it for free on your PC, laptop, Android or iOS device, or use the online versions. If you forgot your Office 365 login details, ask the ICT people
  • Hand in your Media File document in Magister Opdrachten "Media File x", where "x" is the proper Media File number. Make sure the file is no longer open in Word when you send it to Magister Opdrachten, or it may not upload properly.

You can check the following URL for inspiration on how to structure your review:

http://www.booktrust.org.uk/books/teenagers/writing-tips/tips-for-writing-book-reviews/

Rubrics

Your writing will be graded using the rubrics below.

Glossary

  • Ill = Ziek
  • Previous = Vorige
  • Requirements = Eisen
  • Provide = Geven
  • Appropriate = Passend
  • Convincing = Overtuigend
  • Support = Ondersteunen
  • Well-structured = Goed opgebouwd
  • Proper = Goede
  • Preferably = Bij voorkeur
  • Varying = Afwisselende
  • Adjectives = Bijvoeglijk naamwoorden
  • Adverbs = Bijwoorden
  • Fits = Past bij
  • Grade = Jaarlaag
  • Extract = Samenvatting
  • Teasers = Iets dat een beetje verklapt voor mensen die het nog moeten lezen
  • Allowed = Toegestaan
  • Plagiarise = Jatten, dingen overschrijven van iemand anders
  • Access = Toegang
  • ICT people = Mensen van systeembeheer
  • Inspiration = Inspiratie

heading.content: Book Review on YouTube / Vimeo / Google Drive / OneDrive - individual assignment

items.content:
Vlog your book reviews!

Hi there, Yes! Some of you had wonderful analyses in your video diaries last time. Some of them were so good that they had more depth than the blogger reviews. Therefore, for those who feel more at home speaking than writing: vlog away!

During this assignment you need to imagine these things:

  • Your audience: a group of viewers who take your advice when it comes to books.
  • They like to read and they read what you think is right for them.
  • You also give constructive criticism in your vlogs.
  • Sometimes, when you don't like a book, you tell your readers as well and why.

So what makes a great vlog review? (requirements)

  • Bare minimum
  • Depth
  • Greatness

  • It's a video on Youtube, Vimeo, Office 365, GoogleDrive or Dropbox (make it easy to access though!)
  • Post your updated Media File in Magister Opdrachten. This means the file with the link to your video.
  • Min lenght 3 minutes / Max length 5 minutes.
  • You kept in mind what your audience is like (see bullet points above).
  • You give a very brief description of the book and perhaps the author.
    • Maybe you've read more by this author, tell!
    • Maybe show its cover.
    • Perhaps tell something about what's written on the back of the book.
    • Perhaps discuss the title and you can even say something about the characters in general and what they're like but above all:
    • don't spoil the fun with spoilers on the contents!
    • etc.
  • Give 2-5 reasons for why this book is a must read! Give 1-3 points of criticism about the book.
  • It's all about voicing your opinions with good arguments.
  • It's about advising why you should or shouldn't read a book and who should or shouldn't read it.
  • Give a short summary of what you've discussed and give your final verdict.
  • Explain how the book relates to the world.
    • In the past, present or future.
    • Maybe your world, the world in general or the world for specific people.
    • A fictional world.
  • What do you learn / get to know / experience by reading this book?
  • It's a huge benefit if you do something creative to make it interesting and let it speak to one's imagination. The more creative, the better.
  • Jokes and references to media, politics, life in general etc. are of course allowed.

Glossary:

  • therefore = daarom
  • depth = diepte
  • audience = publiek
  • constructive criticism = opbouwende kritiek (zeggen wat je minder vond en hoe het beter kan)
  • access = toegang
  • brief = kort
  • perhaps / maybe = misschien
  • spoil = verpesten
  • verdict = oordeel
  • specific = bepaalde
  • relate = verband houden met
  • benefit = voordeel
  • references = verwijzingen
  • allowed = toegestaan

Rubrics

You can find the Vlog Review Rurbics here.

items.title: Check out this website for some great examples

items.content:
What is Fanfiction?

Fan fiction or fanfiction (also abbreviated to fan fic, fanfic, or fic) is fiction about characters or settings from an original work of fiction, created by fans of that work rather than by its creator.

Fan fiction is defined by being both related to its subject's canonical fictional universe (often referred to as "canon", see below) and simultaneously existing outside it. Most fan fiction writers assume that their work is read primarily by other fans, and therefore presume that their readers have knowledge of the canon universe (created by a professional writer) in which their works are based. (source: wikipedia)

What is Canon?!

It's important to respect canon. This might be a weird word, but let us explain. Example: People in Harry Potter books fly brooms. Giving Hermoine the ability to fly without a broom (or dark magic) would be disrespectful to canon. Changing Hermoine's life however is acceptable. You could, for example, write about Hermoine's parents. They are Muggle and that greatly affects her life (she chose to erase herself from their memory and that hurts her.) You could write a story in which Hermoine is not born from Muggle parents but from wizard parents. Describe how that could affect her personality. Maybe Hermoine is such a great student because she continuously had to prove she herself is a good wizard even though she is Muggle born. If her parents hadn't been muggles she might have worked less hard which could've affected Harry in many ways as well. Hermoine helped Harry in with her knowledge she had acquired by hard work. Had she been less motivated to learn Harry would've faced more challenges alone.

Here are the step-by-step instructions (follow them carefully):

  • Make sure you have an account on FanFiction.net. It may take up to 1 day or even 1 week until you can post something there. This is their way of preventing spam.
  • Make sure you start on time. Check out the deadline date and put it one week earlier, so that you still have time to get ill or have technical problems without being too late.
  • Choose a book of the right level. You can choose it from the "Book Suggestions" chapter on the previous page on this site
  • You can write Fan Fiction individually, or with two people who all have the same teacher of English
  • Write Fan Fiction, meeting the following requirements:
    • It has to be 750-1500 words long (if you work individually) or 2000-3000 words long (if you work with two people)
    • You have total creative freedom, as long as you respect 'canon' (remember, the thing we wrote about above, ask your teacher if you're not sure)
    • Be creative
    • Pay attention to good English grammar and spelling
    • Write as well as you can
  • Post it on FanFiction.net
  • Download the "Hand in Media File and Feedback.docx" document from the "Hand in Media File" chapter on the previous page
  • Cut and paste all the right texts in the right spaces in that document. For the Fan Fiction assignment, this is the URL of the trailer plus the full text of your Fan Fiction
  • Save the file with the file name "class - surname - first name.docx" (for example "3Ab - Janssen - Jan.docx" (if you wrote the Fan Fiction with two people, each person needs to hand it in!)
  • Make sure you save it as a Microsoft Word document. No other file formats (Google Docs, Pages, PDF) are accepted. Everybody at the GSG has free access to Microsoft Office 365. You can install it for free on your PC, laptop, Android or iOS device, or use the online versions. If you forgot your Office 365 login details, ask the ICT people
  • Hand in your Media File document in Magister Opdrachten "Media File x", where "x" is the proper Media File number. Make sure the file is no longer open in Word when you send it to Magister Opdrachten, or it may not upload properly.

Rubrics

You will find three rubrics in the file below A second, third and fourth/fifth year rubric. The second year rubric can also be used for pupils doing a Media File assignment in the first year.

Glossary

  • sign up = inschrijven
  • spam = ongewilde mail/posts/verhalen
  • abbreviated = afgekort
  • characters = personages
  • original = origineel
  • created = gemaakt
  • rather than = meer dan
  • defined = gedefinieerd, gekenmerkt door
  • assume = aannemen
  • primarily = voornamelijk
  • therefore = daarom
  • presume = aannemen
  • knowledge = kennis
  • canon = de regels omtrent het veranderen van de fictie uit het boek. (zoals het niet veranderen van namen van karakters of essentiële elementen uit een verhaal.)
  • simultaneuously = tegelijkertijd
  • existing = bestaan
  • outside = buiten
  • universe = universum
  • based = gebasseerd
  • source = bron
  • delay = vertraging
  • Hermoine = Hermelien
  • broom = bezem
  • important = belangrijk
  • respect = respecteren en daarom niet aanpassen
  • without = zonder
  • would = zou
  • changing = veranderen
  • however = hoewel
  • acceptable = acceptabel
  • could = zou kunnen
  • in which = waarin
  • born from = geboren uit
  • wizard = tovenaar
  • describe = omschrijf
  • affect = beïnvloeden, aantasten
  • personality = persoonlijkheid
  • Maybe = misschien
  • such = zo'n
  • because = omdat
  • continuously = voortdurend
  • prove = bewijzen
  • event hough = zelfs
  • muggle born = geboren uit Dreuzels
  • acquired = opgedaan
  • challenges = uitdagingen

heading.content: Write to an Author - individual assignment

items.content:
Requirements

1 Language:

  • Your grammar and spelling should be appropriate for your grade.
  • Your language use / tone should be polite and formal.

2 Execution:

  • The letter shouldn't feel as though you had to write it for school.
  • The letter should come across as genuine interest from a reader.
  • The letter is not a list of points nor should it feel like you worked through several bullet points. It should be coherent, fluent and structured nicely.

3 Style:

  • Use a formal letter style but leave out things like your / the author's address. You can find the formal letter format here: http://maken.wikiwijs.nl/94572/4_Let_s_Grow__Writing#!page-2951076

4 Structure & Content:

Introduction:

  • Introduce yourself, mention at least 4 things in a nice opening paragraph.
  • Explain why you are writing this email and make sure it doesn't sound like you have to do it for school.

Body 1: (paragraph 1)

  • Explain why you chose this book in particular.
  • Tell how long it took you to read it and why.
  • Explain how the book made you feel and why.
  • Tell who your favourite charachter(s) is / are and why.
  • Explain what you would do if you were the main character.
  • Explain which parts you really liked and which parts you liked less and why.
  • Explain what you would change but make sure you don't come across as condescending. These are published authors. They generally know how to write a good book.
  • Explain what you thought of the ending of the book.

Body 2: (paragraph 2)

  • Ask the author at least three intelligent questions. The questions should be questions you wouldn't find an answer to in online interviews or in a biography. Questions like: "Do you have pets?", "How long have you been an author?" or "Do you do anything else besides writing?" should not be asked. Go for something like: "If you could write this book again, what would you change and why?".

End the letter:

  • Say something to conclude your letter.
  • Wish the author something for the future.
  • Express something you hope regarding the book for the future.
  • Express the wish to receive a response.

Sending and handing in your email:

  • Find the email address of the author, their agent or the email address of the publishing company where they published their book.
  • Send the email to the author, their agent or the publishing company
  • Make a screenshot of the sent email (go to 'sent items'/'sent'/'verzonden'/'verzonden items'/'postvak uit', open your sent email and make a screenshot) and save it
  • Copy the screenshot of your email to the 'Hand in Media File' Word file that you find in the 'Hand in Media File' lesson of this course
  • Copy the full text of your email to the 'Hand in Media File' Word file that you find in the 'Hand in Media File' lesson of this course
  • Once you have also included you Book Analysis in this document you can hand it in in Magister Opdrachten

Glossary

  • to conclude= afsluiten
  • appropriate= passend
  • grade= leerlaag
  • to mention= noemen
  • cliffhanger= 'open end'/ climax
  • to exceed= overschrijden
  • obscure= vreemd
  • requirements= eisen
  • sophisticated= op hoog niveau
  • sufficient= voldoende
  • effort= moeite / inspanning
  • to be graded= beoordeeld worden
  • Your email will be graded using the following 'rubrics'.
  • coherent = samenhangend
  • several = verscheidene
  • regarding = aangaande (wat betreft ...)
  • receive = ontvangen
  • condescending = neerbuigend
  • generally = in het algemeen
  • published = gepubliceerde (Een uitgeverij vond het boek goed genoeg om er heel veel geld in te investeren en dacht dat dus ook ruimschoots terug te kunnen verdienen.)
  • come across =overkomen
  • as though = alsof
  • genuine = oprecht
  • polite = beleefd
  • formal = formeel, netjes
  • in particular = in het bijzonder
Rubrics

heading.content: A trailer for your Book - individual / duo / group assignment

items.content:
What is a trailer?

A trailer is a little story that tells some (or maybe even most) of the story. A trailer is a very short version of a movie...but in this case your book.
For inspiration, feel free to check out this "How to make an Epic Trailer" video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHL-tJgl3Gw

Here are the step-by-step instructions (follow them carefully):

  • Make sure you have a Google account. This also gives you access to Youtube, where you can easily publish your video
  • Make sure you start on time. Check out the deadline date and put it one week earlier, so that you still have time to get ill or have technical problems without being too late.
  • Choose a book of the right level. You can choose it from the "Book Suggestions" chapter on the previous page on this site
  • You can make the trailer individually, or with a group of up to 4 people who all have the same teacher of English
  • Create a trailer, meeting the following requirements:
    • Pay attention to good English grammar and spelling
    • Make sure it fits the content of the book
    • Make sure it doesn't contain too much copyright material (including sound) or else Youtube may block it
    • The trailer encourages other readers to try the book
    • You may add bloopers for fun :-)
    • Duration between 2 and 4 minutes
    • Use at least four elements of an epic trailer (see the Youtube video at the top of this page)
      The elements mentioned are:
      • Impacts & explosions
      • Fade to black
      • Rapid edits
      • Reaction shot
      • Epic statements
      • Sound effects
      • Slow motion
      • People running
      • Scale
  • Make sure you edit and store the video in a file format that Youtube accepts (like .AVI and .MP4)
  • Login to Youtube (using your Google account). If you end up on the Google mail page, click on the 3x3 grid of blocks at the top right and choose "Youtube".
  • Click on the little arrow pointing up, to the left of your avatar/personal icon (which is located the the right top of the screen)
  • Click on "Unlisted"/"Verborgen" (not "Private"/"Privé"!). This way only people who know the exact URL will be able to view it, and it won't show up on Youtube search results
  • While uploading, Youtube will tell you the link that will be generated to access it. Copy that link.
  • Have the link tested by someone who is not logged into your Google account - that way you can see if your teacher can access it ;-)
  • Download the "Hand in Media File and Feedback.docx" document from the "Hand in Media File" chapter on the previous page
  • Cut and paste all the right texts in the right spaces in that document. For the trailer assignment, this is the URL of the trailer
  • Save the file with the file name "class - surname - first name.docx" (for example "3Ab - Janssen - Jan.docx" (if you make trailer with more people, each person needs to hand it in!)
  • Make sure you save it as a Microsoft Word document. No other file formats (Google Docs, Pages, PDF) are accepted. Everybody at the GSG has free access to Microsoft Office 365. You can install it for free on your PC, laptop, Android or iOS device, or use the online versions. If you forgot your Office 365 login details, ask the ICT people
  • Hand in your Media File document in Magister Opdrachten "Media File x", where "x" is the proper Media File number. Make sure the file is no longer open in Word when you send it to Magister Opdrachten, or it may not upload properly.

Rubrics

Glossary

Access = Toegang / toegang hebben tot
Publish = Publiceren
Individually = Alleen, in je eentje
Requirements = Eisen
Duration = Tijdsduur
Encourages = Moedigt aan
Previous = Vorige
Duration = Tijdsduur
Epic = Episch, waanzinnig

Book Genre Test

Below you will find a link to a test. The outcome of this test will help you determine which books you will probably like! How cool is that? This means you will enjoy reading much more.

People often don't like reading because they choose books that don't appeal to them. Why would you read something that's not your taste? You don't wear clothes in colours you don't like either, do you?

Go ahead and check out the test and start reading!

Glossary:

  • outcome: resultaat
  • determine: bepalen
  • probably: waarschijnlijk
  • appeal: aanspreken
  • taste: smaak
  • either: ook

items.title: Click this Link to do the Test and then choose "Start"

items.content:
Book Suggestions

It is a challenge to find the right book to read. Below you will find a list of books we suggest. If you want to read a book that is not on this list, please first ask your teacher if it is allowed (and the original of the book needs to be in English!). Feel free to Google or Wikipedia a book title to see if the subject is something you'd like.

You may read only 1 book of any author per year, and 5th graders cannot read any of the books they have already read in 4th grade!

At the bottom of the page you will find several of the books that you can read for your Media Files in ebook format. This is an "as-is" service, so no technical support can/will be provided by your teacher. Most of the files have not even been tested. However, the following URLs might help you along...

http://jeanienefrost.com/discount-ebooks/how-to-re...
http://www.ipadable.com/read-epub-mobi-files-ipad/
http://lifehacker.com/5875516/the-best-ereader-for...
http://ebook.online-convert.com/convert-to-epub

items.title: Link to downloadable free ebooks (bottom of the page)

items.content:
Handing in the Media File and receiving Feedback

The Word document below 'Hand in Media File' is used to hand in your Media Files in Magister Opdrachten.

Instructions:

  • Download the document 'Hand in Media File' (see below)
  • Save the document changing the name to: your class, your last name, your first name (for example: 3Ab DeBoer Luca.docx)

In the document you:

  • insert the links to your Assignment (or paste a screenshot of the e-mail to the author)
  • insert the full text of you Assignment,
  • insert the full text of your Book Analysis

You hand in the document containing your Media File Assignment via Magister Opdrachten.

Feedback and grade:

  • You will receive feedback on your Assignment and Book Analysis from your teacher based on the rubrics.
  • You will receive one grade for your Assignment and one grade for your Book Analysis. The average of these grades will be your Media File grade for that period which counts 2x.

Deadlines:

Media File 1: Friday 2nd of December

Media File 2: Friday 10th of March

Media File 3: Friday 19th of May

For every day that your assignment is late, 0,5 point will be deducted from your total grade.

Hand In The Media File document

Download and save the file changing its name to your class, you last name, you first name (eg. 3Ab de Boer Luca) Deadlines Media File 1: Friday 2nd of December Media File 2: Friday 10th of March Media File 3: Friday 19th of May

Instructions

Download and save the file changing its name to your class, you last name, you first name (eg. 3Ab de Boer Luca) Deadlines Media File 1: Friday 2nd of December Media File 2: Friday 10th of March Media File 3: Friday 19th of May

items.title: Hand In The Media File document

items.content:
Glossary

  • related = gerelateerd, verwant aan
  • insert = invoegen
  • description = omschrijving
  • provide = voorzie van, lever aan, geef
  • average = gemiddelde
  • deducted = in mindering gebracht

What you should and should not do posting things online

Posting a video or piece of writing online about a book you have read is a pretty innocent thing. Not much harm can come from that. Nevertheless, we want you to be aware of the things you should think about before posting anything online whether that is for your media file, facebook, whatsapp or twitter....

Consider this:

  • how will you feel about your post in 5, 10 or 20 years?
  • how do you want to present yourself to other people (those you know and those you don't know?
  • who can see and share your post?
  • what could be the possible consequences of other people sharing your post?

Privacy settings in your accounts:

  • 'Private' usually means you are the only one who can see your own post, you can not share it with anyone unless they know your log in
  • 'Public' usually means everyone can see your post
  • 'Not listed' means your post can not be searched for by other people but you can share a link with others so they can see your post
